scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: Who's there?

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: FRANCISCO
text: Nay, answer me: stand, and unfold yourself.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: Long live the king!

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: FRANCISCO
text: Bernardo?

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: He.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: FRANCISCO
text: You come most carefully upon your hour.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: 'Tis now struck twelve; get thee to bed, Francisco.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: FRANCISCO
text: For this relief much thanks: 'tis bitter cold,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: FRANCISCO
text: And I am sick at heart.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: Have you had quiet guard?

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: FRANCISCO
text: Not a mouse stirring.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: Well, good night.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: If you do meet Horatio and Marcellus,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: The rivals of my watch, bid them make haste.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: FRANCISCO
text: I think I hear them. Stand, ho! Who's there?

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Friends to this ground.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: And liegemen to the Dane.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: FRANCISCO
text: Give you good night.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: O, farewell, honest soldier:

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: Who hath relieved you?

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: FRANCISCO
text: Bernardo has my place.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: FRANCISCO
text: Give you good night.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: Holla! Bernardo!

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: Say,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: What, is Horatio there?

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: A piece of him.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: Welcome, Horatio: welcome, good Marcellus.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: What, has this thing appear'd again to-night?

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: I have seen nothing.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: Horatio says 'tis but our fantasy,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: And will not let belief take hold of him

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: Touching this dreaded sight, twice seen of us:

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: Therefore I have entreated him along

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: With us to watch the minutes of this night;

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: That if again this apparition come,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: He may approve our eyes and speak to it.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Tush, tush, 'twill not appear.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: Sit down awhile;

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: And let us once again assail your ears,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: That are so fortified against our story

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: What we have two nights seen.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Well, sit we down,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: And let us hear Bernardo speak of this.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: Last night of all,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: When yond same star that's westward from the pole

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: Had made his course to illume that part of heaven

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: Where now it burns, Marcellus and myself,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: The bell then beating one,--

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: Peace, break thee off; look, where it comes again!

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: In the same figure, like the king that's dead.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: Thou art a scholar; speak to it, Horatio.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: Looks it not like the king? mark it, Horatio.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Most like: it harrows me with fear and wonder.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: It would be spoke to.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: Question it, Horatio.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: What art thou that usurp'st this time of night,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Together with that fair and warlike form

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: In which the majesty of buried Denmark

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Did sometimes march? by heaven I charge thee, speak!

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: It is offended.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: See, it stalks away!

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Stay! speak, speak! I charge thee, speak!

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: 'Tis gone, and will not answer.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: How now, Horatio! you tremble and look pale:

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: Is not this something more than fantasy?

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: What think you on't?

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Before my God, I might not this believe

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Without the sensible and true avouch

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Of mine own eyes.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: Is it not like the king?

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: As thou art to thyself:

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Such was the very armour he had on

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: When he the ambitious Norway combated;

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: So frown'd he once, when, in an angry parle,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: He smote the sledded Polacks on the ice.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: 'Tis strange.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: Thus twice before, and jump at this dead hour,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: With martial stalk hath he gone by our watch.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: In what particular thought to work I know not;

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: But in the gross and scope of my opinion,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: This bodes some strange eruption to our state.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: Good now, sit down, and tell me, he that knows,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: Why this same strict and most observant watch

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: So nightly toils the subject of the land,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: And why such daily cast of brazen cannon,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: And foreign mart for implements of war;

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: Why such impress of shipwrights, whose sore task

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: Does not divide the Sunday from the week;

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: What might be toward, that this sweaty haste

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: Doth make the night joint-labourer with the day:

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: Who is't that can inform me?

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: That can I;

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: At least, the whisper goes so. Our last king,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Whose image even but now appear'd to us,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Was, as you know, by Fortinbras of Norway,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Thereto prick'd on by a most emulate pride,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Dared to the combat; in which our valiant Hamlet--

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: For so this side of our known world esteem'd him--

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Did slay this Fortinbras; who by a seal'd compact,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Well ratified by law and heraldry,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Did forfeit, with his life, all those his lands

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Which he stood seized of, to the conqueror:

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Against the which, a moiety competent

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Was gaged by our king; which had return'd

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: To the inheritance of Fortinbras,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Had he been vanquisher; as, by the same covenant,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: And carriage of the article design'd,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: His fell to Hamlet. Now, sir, young Fortinbras,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Of unimproved mettle hot and full,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Hath in the skirts of Norway here and there

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Shark'd up a list of lawless resolutes,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: For food and diet, to some enterprise

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: That hath a stomach in't; which is no other--

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: As it doth well appear unto our state--

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: But to recover of us, by strong hand

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: And terms compulsatory, those foresaid lands

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: So by his father lost: and this, I take it,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Is the main motive of our preparations,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: The source of this our watch and the chief head

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Of this post-haste and romage in the land.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: I think it be no other but e'en so:

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: Well may it sort that this portentous figure

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: Comes armed through our watch; so like the king

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: That was and is the question of these wars.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: A mote it is to trouble the mind's eye.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: In the most high and palmy state of Rome,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: A little ere the mightiest Julius fell,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: The graves stood tenantless and the sheeted dead

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Did squeak and gibber in the Roman streets:

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: As stars with trains of fire and dews of blood,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Disasters in the sun; and the moist star

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Upon whose influence Neptune's empire stands

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Was sick almost to doomsday with eclipse:

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: And even the like precurse of fierce events,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: As harbingers preceding still the fates

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: And prologue to the omen coming on,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Have heaven and earth together demonstrated

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Unto our climatures and countrymen.--

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: But soft, behold! lo, where it comes again!

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: I'll cross it, though it blast me. Stay, illusion!

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: If thou hast any sound, or use of voice,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Speak to me:

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: If there be any good thing to be done,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: That may to thee do ease and grace to me,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Speak to me:

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: If thou art privy to thy country's fate,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Which, happily, foreknowing may avoid, O, speak!

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Or if thou hast uphoarded in thy life

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Extorted treasure in the womb of earth,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: For which, they say, you spirits oft walk in death,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Speak of it: stay, and speak! Stop it, Marcellus.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: Shall I strike at it with my partisan?

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Do, if it will not stand.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: 'Tis here!

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: 'Tis here!

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: 'Tis gone!

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: We do it wrong, being so majestical,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: To offer it the show of violence;

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: For it is, as the air, invulnerable,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: And our vain blows malicious mockery.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
text: It was about to speak, when the cock crew.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: And then it started like a guilty thing

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Upon a fearful summons. I have heard,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: The cock, that is the trumpet to the morn,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Doth with his lofty and shrill-sounding throat

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Awake the god of day; and, at his warning,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Whether in sea or fire, in earth or air,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: The extravagant and erring spirit hies

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: To his confine: and of the truth herein

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: This present object made probation.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: It faded on the crowing of the cock.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: Some say that ever 'gainst that season comes

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: Wherein our Saviour's birth is celebrated,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: The bird of dawning singeth all night long:

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: And then, they say, no spirit dares stir abroad;

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: The nights are wholesome; then no planets strike,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: No fairy takes, nor witch hath power to charm,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: So hallow'd and so gracious is the time.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: So have I heard and do in part believe it.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: But, look, the morn, in russet mantle clad,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Walks o'er the dew of yon high eastward hill:

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Break we our watch up; and by my advice,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Let us impart what we have seen to-night

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Unto young Hamlet; for, upon my life,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: This spirit, dumb to us, will speak to him.

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Do you consent we shall acquaint him with it,

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: As needful in our loves, fitting our duty?

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: Let's do't, I pray; and I this morning know

scene: SCENE I. Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: Where we shall find him most conveniently.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Though yet of Hamlet our dear brother's death

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: The memory be green, and that it us befitted

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: To bear our hearts in grief and our whole kingdom

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: To be contracted in one brow of woe,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Yet so far hath discretion fought with nature

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: That we with wisest sorrow think on him,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Together with remembrance of ourselves.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Therefore our sometime sister, now our queen,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: The imperial jointress to this warlike state,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Have we, as 'twere with a defeated joy,--

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: With an auspicious and a dropping eye,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: With mirth in funeral and with dirge in marriage,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: In equal scale weighing delight and dole,--

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Taken to wife: nor have we herein barr'd

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Your better wisdoms, which have freely gone

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: With this affair along. For all, our thanks.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Now follows, that you know, young Fortinbras,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Holding a weak supposal of our worth,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Or thinking by our late dear brother's death

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Our state to be disjoint and out of frame,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Colleagued with the dream of his advantage,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: He hath not fail'd to pester us with message,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Importing the surrender of those lands

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Lost by his father, with all bonds of law,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: To our most valiant brother. So much for him.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Now for ourself and for this time of meeting:

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Thus much the business is: we have here writ

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: To Norway, uncle of young Fortinbras,--

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Who, impotent and bed-rid, scarcely hears

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Of this his nephew's purpose,--to suppress

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: His further gait herein; in that the levies,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: The lists and full proportions, are all made

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Out of his subject: and we here dispatch

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: You, good Cornelius, and you, Voltimand,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: For bearers of this greeting to old Norway;

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Giving to you no further personal power

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: To business with the king, more than the scope

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Of these delated articles allow.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Farewell, and let your haste commend your duty.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: CORNELIUS
text: In that and all things will we show our duty.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: We doubt it nothing: heartily farewell.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: And now, Laertes, what's the news with you?

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: You told us of some suit; what is't, Laertes?

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: You cannot speak of reason to the Dane,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: And loose your voice: what wouldst thou beg, Laertes,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: That shall not be my offer, not thy asking?

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: The head is not more native to the heart,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: The hand more instrumental to the mouth,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Than is the throne of Denmark to thy father.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: What wouldst thou have, Laertes?

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
text: My dread lord,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
text: Your leave and favour to return to France;

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
text: From whence though willingly I came to Denmark,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
text: To show my duty in your coronation,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
text: Yet now, I must confess, that duty done,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
text: My thoughts and wishes bend again toward France

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
text: And bow them to your gracious leave and pardon.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Have you your father's leave? What says Polonius?

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text: He hath, my lord, wrung from me my slow leave

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text: By laboursome petition, and at last

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text: Upon his will I seal'd my hard consent:

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
text: I do beseech you, give him leave to go.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Take thy fair hour, Laertes; time be thine,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: And thy best graces spend it at thy will!

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: But now, my cousin Hamlet, and my son,--

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: How is it that the clouds still hang on you?

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Not so, my lord; I am too much i' the sun.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text: Good Hamlet, cast thy nighted colour off,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text: And let thine eye look like a friend on Denmark.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text: Do not for ever with thy vailed lids

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text: Seek for thy noble father in the dust:

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text: Thou know'st 'tis common; all that lives must die,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text: Passing through nature to eternity.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Ay, madam, it is common.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text: If it be,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text: Why seems it so particular with thee?

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Seems, madam! nay it is; I know not 'seems.'

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: 'Tis not alone my inky cloak, good mother,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Nor customary suits of solemn black,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Nor windy suspiration of forced breath,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: No, nor the fruitful river in the eye,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Nor the dejected 'havior of the visage,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Together with all forms, moods, shapes of grief,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: That can denote me truly: these indeed seem,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: For they are actions that a man might play:

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: But I have that within which passeth show;

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: These but the trappings and the suits of woe.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: 'Tis sweet and commendable in your nature, Hamlet,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: To give these mourning duties to your father:

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: But, you must know, your father lost a father;

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: That father lost, lost his, and the survivor bound

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: In filial obligation for some term

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: To do obsequious sorrow: but to persever

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: In obstinate condolement is a course

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Of impious stubbornness; 'tis unmanly grief;

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: It shows a will most incorrect to heaven,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: A heart unfortified, a mind impatient,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: An understanding simple and unschool'd:

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: For what we know must be and is as common

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: As any the most vulgar thing to sense,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Why should we in our peevish opposition

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Take it to heart? Fie! 'tis a fault to heaven,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: A fault against the dead, a fault to nature,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: To reason most absurd: whose common theme

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Is death of fathers, and who still hath cried,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: From the first corse till he that died to-day,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: 'This must be so.' We pray you, throw to earth

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: This unprevailing woe, and think of us

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: As of a father: for let the world take note,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: You are the most immediate to our throne;

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: And with no less nobility of love

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Than that which dearest father bears his son,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Do I impart toward you. For your intent

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: In going back to school in Wittenberg,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: It is most retrograde to our desire:

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: And we beseech you, bend you to remain

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Here, in the cheer and comfort of our eye,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Our chiefest courtier, cousin, and our son.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text: Let not thy mother lose her prayers, Hamlet:

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text: I pray thee, stay with us; go not to Wittenberg.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: I shall in all my best obey you, madam.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Why, 'tis a loving and a fair reply:

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Be as ourself in Denmark. Madam, come;

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: This gentle and unforced accord of Hamlet

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Sits smiling to my heart: in grace whereof,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: No jocund health that Denmark drinks to-day,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: But the great cannon to the clouds shall tell,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: And the king's rouse the heavens all bruit again,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Re-speaking earthly thunder. Come away.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: O, that this too too solid flesh would melt

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Thaw and resolve itself into a dew!

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Or that the Everlasting had not fix'd

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: His canon 'gainst self-slaughter! O God! God!

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: How weary, stale, flat and unprofitable,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Seem to me all the uses of this world!

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Fie on't! ah fie! 'tis an unweeded garden,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: That grows to seed; things rank and gross in nature

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Possess it merely. That it should come to this!

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: But two months dead: nay, not so much, not two:

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: So excellent a king; that was, to this,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Hyperion to a satyr; so loving to my mother

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: That he might not beteem the winds of heaven

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Visit her face too roughly. Heaven and earth!

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Must I remember? why, she would hang on him,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: As if increase of appetite had grown

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: By what it fed on: and yet, within a month--

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Let me not think on't--Frailty, thy name is woman!--

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: A little month, or ere those shoes were old

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: With which she follow'd my poor father's body,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Like Niobe, all tears:--why she, even she--

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: O, God! a beast, that wants discourse of reason,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Would have mourn'd longer--married with my uncle,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: My father's brother, but no more like my father

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Than I to Hercules: within a month:

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Ere yet the salt of most unrighteous tears

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Had left the flushing in her galled eyes,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: She married. O, most wicked speed, to post

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: With such dexterity to incestuous sheets!

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: It is not nor it cannot come to good:

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: But break, my heart; for I must hold my tongue.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Hail to your lordship!

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: I am glad to see you well:

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Horatio,--or I do forget myself.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: The same, my lord, and your poor servant ever.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Sir, my good friend; I'll change that name with you:

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: And what make you from Wittenberg, Horatio? Marcellus?

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: My good lord--

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: I am very glad to see you. Good even, sir.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: But what, in faith, make you from Wittenberg?

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: A truant disposition, good my lord.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: I would not hear your enemy say so,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Nor shall you do mine ear that violence,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: To make it truster of your own report

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Against yourself: I know you are no truant.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: But what is your affair in Elsinore?

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: We'll teach you to drink deep ere you depart.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: My lord, I came to see your father's funeral.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: I pray thee, do not mock me, fellow-student;

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: I think it was to see my mother's wedding.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Indeed, my lord, it follow'd hard upon.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Thrift, thrift, Horatio! the funeral baked meats

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Did coldly furnish forth the marriage tables.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Would I had met my dearest foe in heaven

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Or ever I had seen that day, Horatio!

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: My father!--methinks I see my father.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Where, my lord?

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: In my mind's eye, Horatio.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: I saw him once; he was a goodly king.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: He was a man, take him for all in all,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: I shall not look upon his like again.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: My lord, I think I saw him yesternight.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Saw? who?

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: My lord, the king your father.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: The king my father!

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Season your admiration for awhile

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: With an attent ear, till I may deliver,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Upon the witness of these gentlemen,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: This marvel to you.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: For God's love, let me hear.

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Two nights together had these gentlemen,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Marcellus and Bernardo, on their watch,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: In the dead vast and middle of the night,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Been thus encounter'd. A figure like your father,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Armed at point exactly, cap-a-pe,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Appears before them, and with solemn march

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Goes slow and stately by them: thrice he walk'd

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: By their oppress'd and fear-surprised eyes,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Within his truncheon's length; whilst they, distilled

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Almost to jelly with the act of fear,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Stand dumb and speak not to him. This to me

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: In dreadful secrecy impart they did;

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: And I with them the third night kept the watch;

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Where, as they had deliver'd, both in time,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Form of the thing, each word made true and good,

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: The apparition comes: I knew your father;

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO

scene: SCENE II. A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET

speaker: HAMLET

text: As you are friends, scholars and soldiers,

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Give me one poor request.

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HORATIO
text: What is't, my lord? we will.

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Never make known what you have seen to-night.

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HORATIO
text: My lord, we will not.

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Nay, but swear't.

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HORATIO
text: In faith,

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HORATIO
text: My lord, not I.

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: Nor I, my lord, in faith.

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Upon my sword.

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: MARCELLUS
text: We have sworn, my lord, already.

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Indeed, upon my sword, indeed.

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Ah, ha, boy! say'st thou so? art thou there,

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: truepenny?

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Come on--you hear this fellow in the cellarage--

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Consent to swear.

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Propose the oath, my lord.

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Never to speak of this that you have seen,

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Swear by my sword.

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Hic et ubique? then we'll shift our ground.

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Come hither, gentlemen,

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: And lay your hands again upon my sword:

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Never to speak of this that you have heard,

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Swear by my sword.

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Well said, old mole! canst work i' the earth so fast?

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: A worthy pioner! Once more remove, good friends.

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HORATIO
text: O day and night, but this is wondrous strange!

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: And therefore as a stranger give it welcome.

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: There are more things in heaven and earth, Horatio,

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Than are dreamt of in your philosophy. But come;

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Here, as before, never, so help you mercy,

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: How strange or odd soe'er I bear myself,

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: As I perchance hereafter shall think meet

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: To put an antic disposition on,

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: That you, at such times seeing me, never shall,

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: With arms encumber'd thus, or this headshake,

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Or by pronouncing of some doubtful phrase,

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: As 'Well, well, we know,' or 'We could, an if we would,'

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Or 'If we list to speak,' or 'There be, an if they might,'

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Or such ambiguous giving out, to note

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: That you know aught of me: this not to do,

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: So grace and mercy at your most need help you, Swear.

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Rest, rest, perturbed spirit!

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: So, gentlemen,

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: With all my love I do commend me to you:

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: And what so poor a man as Hamlet is

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: May do, to express his love and friending to you,

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: God willing, shall not lack. Let us go in together;

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: And still your fingers on your lips, I pray.

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: The time is out of joint: O cursed spite,

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: That ever I was born to set it right!

scene: SCENE V. Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Nay, come, let's go together.

scene: SCENE VII. Another room in the castle.

text: Now must your conscience my acquaintance seal,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

speaker: LAERTES

scene: SCENE VII. Another room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES

speaker: LAERTES

scene: SCENE VII. Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: O, for two special reasons;

scene: SCENE VII. Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Which may to you, perhaps, seem much unsinew'd,

scene: SCENE VII. Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: But yet to me they are strong. The queen his mother

scene: SCENE VII. Another room in the castle.

text: Lives almost by his looks; and for myself--

scene: SCENE VII. Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

scene: SCENE VII. Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: She's so conjunctive to my life and soul,

scene: SCENE VII. Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: That, as the star moves not but in his sphere,

scene: SCENE VII. Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: I could not but by her. The other motive,

scene: SCENE VII. Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Why to a public count I might not go,

scene: SCENE VII. Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Is the great love the general gender bear him;

scene: SCENE VII. Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Who, dipping all his faults in their affection,

scene: SCENE VII. Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Would, like the spring that turneth wood to stone,

scene: SCENE VII. Another room in the castle.

scene: SCENE VII. Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: And not where I had aim'd them.

scene: SCENE VII. Another room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES

scene: SCENE VII. Another room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES

scene: SCENE VII. Another room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
text: Whose worth, if praises may go back again,

scene: SCENE VII. Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text: Break not your sleeps for that: you must not think

scene: SCENE VII. Another room in the castle.

text: Give me the cup: let go; by heaven, I'll have't.

speaker: HAMLET
text: O good Horatio, what a wounded name,

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Things standing thus unknown, shall live behind me!

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: If thou didst ever hold me in thy heart

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Absent thee from felicity awhile,

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: And in this harsh world draw thy breath in pain,

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: To tell my story.

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: What warlike noise is this?

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: OSRIC
text: Young Fortinbras, with conquest come from Poland,

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: OSRIC
text: To the ambassadors of England gives

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: OSRIC
text: This warlike volley.

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: O, I die, Horatio;

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: The potent poison quite o'er-crows my spirit:

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: I cannot live to hear the news from England;

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: But I do prophesy the election lights

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: On Fortinbras: he has my dying voice;

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: So tell him, with the occurrents, more and less,

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
text: Which have solicited. The rest is silence.

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Now cracks a noble heart. Good night sweet prince:

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: And flights of angels sing thee to thy rest!

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Why does the drum come hither?

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text: Where is this sight?

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: What is it ye would see?

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: If aught of woe or wonder, cease your search.

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text: This quarry cries on havoc. O proud death,

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text: What feast is toward in thine eternal cell,

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text: That thou so many princes at a shot

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text: So bloodily hast struck?

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: First Ambassador
text: The sight is dismal;

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: First Ambassador
text: And our affairs from England come too late:

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: First Ambassador
text: The ears are senseless that should give us hearing,

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: First Ambassador
text: To tell him his commandment is fulfill'd,

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: First Ambassador
text: That Rosencrantz and Guildenstern are dead:

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: First Ambassador
text: Where should we have our thanks?

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Not from his mouth,

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Had it the ability of life to thank you:

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: He never gave commandment for their death.

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: But since, so jump upon this bloody question,

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: You from the Polack wars, and you from England,

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Are here arrived give order that these bodies

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: High on a stage be placed to the view;

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: And let me speak to the yet unknowing world

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: How these things came about: so shall you hear

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Of carnal, bloody, and unnatural acts,

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Of accidental judgments, casual slaughters,

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Of deaths put on by cunning and forced cause,

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: And, in this upshot, purposes mistook

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Fall'n on the inventors' reads: all this can I

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Truly deliver.

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text: Let us haste to hear it,

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text: And call the noblest to the audience.

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text: For me, with sorrow I embrace my fortune:

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text: I have some rights of memory in this kingdom,

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text: Which now to claim my vantage doth invite me.

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Of that I shall have also cause to speak,

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: And from his mouth whose voice will draw on more;

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: But let this same be presently perform'd,

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: Even while men's minds are wild; lest more mischance

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
text: On plots and errors, happen.

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text: Let four captains

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text: Bear Hamlet, like a soldier, to the stage;

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text: For he was likely, had he been put on,

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text: To have proved most royally: and, for his passage,

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text: The soldiers' music and the rites of war

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text: Speak loudly for him.

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text: Take up the bodies: such a sight as this

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text: Becomes the field, but here shows much amiss.

scene: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.
speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text: Go, bid the soldiers shoot.
